pros: Great students to work with!
cons: Not enough convenient parking spaces.

review_title: Not Bad, but could be better
job_title: IT Support Specialist in Geneva, NY
pros: Community is fantastic, Finger lakes region is beautiful
cons: Sometimes it feels like they aren't too interested in developing and maintaining staff

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Geneva, NY
pros: Laid back atmosphere and friendly campus.
cons: Sometimes did not get annual raises

pros: Great experience to guide peers, assist with papers and study materials
cons: Minimum wage pay, 4-7 hours a week

pros:
- Great hands on experience
- Great networking opportunity
cons: - diversity and inclusion lacking within office

pros: Good school, good time, good people
cons: No cons here at this school

pros: Work was interesting, pay was good, flexible hours, and great opportunity.
cons: Zoom was difficult to communicate through sometimes

pros: Flexible scheduling and make your own hours based on campus events.
cons: Sometimes boring and length of events was not always clear.

job_title: Student Worker in New York, NY
pros: Learning and networking with people
cons: There aren't many bad things about being a student worker

pros: innovative imaginative hard-working beautiful unique
cons: none that i can think of

pros: welcoming staff, provides extensive training
cons: minimum wage, partners with sodexo

pros: Diversity. Inclusion, Community, Team Work, Friendly
cons: Small School, Not the best food

review_title: Low pay, expensive health and dental benefits, many responsibilities
pros:
Good for candidates with little experience
Flexibility to work from home (since start of pandemic)
Working with college students/intellectuals
Making strides toward DEI
Tuition benefits for family members can make up for poor pay
cons: Pay is poor - my family health/dental benefits cost a quarter of my salary.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in San Diego, CA
pros: great students, lovely colleagues and departments
cons: low pay (but that's adjuncting); HR is a bit of a mess

job_title: Student Athletic Trainer in Geneva, NY
pros: Great certified athletic trainers that head the Sports Medicine Department. They give you a lot of opportunities to work independently and learn the basics of working in sports medicine.
cons: Sometimes had to work very early/late hours.

pros: Working within the academic community.
cons: Working at a local college.

pros: Great place to work, loved it!
cons: None that I could think of

pros: The faculty and staff there are absolutely amazing. They are so supportive of one another and so easily approachable. There really truly is an atmosphere of mutual respect and teamwork.
cons: Sometimes it is very uncomfortable and difficult to approach the Principal. Sometimes she has an attitude that deters people from asking for help or guidance. I was afraid to give her suggestions, as she does not accept constructive criticism well.

pros: You will work with some of the most dedicated people you can find. Good benefits.
cons: Management refuses to mentor and if necessary remove the people holding back forward progress. Very much "old boys club" mentality in athletics. Salary well under average. Very little concern for healthy work/life balance. No effort to retain good people. Very hesitant and resistant to work towards necessary change. Maintaining appearances is the #1 concern. Pushed to promote corporate alliance members rather than best choice.

pros: Having a job on campus can be a wonderful thing for a student. This job in particular was amazing for me because I was able to have an administrative role, impact students' lives, and work in a nice environment with my own responsibilities.
cons: Working a job at college inherently comes with cons, and that is it takes time away from studying or socializing. Like everything else, it is not difficult to balance your time but make sure you figure that out sooner rather than later.

pros: They offer excellent benefits. You will have nice coworkers. The President is a really personable guy who knows most everyone by name.
cons: They don't pay very much, the work is incredibly difficult and under appreciated. Most students are really entitled and get whatever they want if they make a big enough stink.

review_title: If you truly care about students, and are willing to put in extra time, you will be successful here!
pros: City is progressive and Many Faculty and staff live near by since housing is affordable and schools are great.  Campus is gorgeous and most students are thoughtful and hardworking! Awesome benefits.
cons: Small percentage of students have unrealistic perception of what it takes to be successful which can be frustrating. Can’t think of anything else, overall great place!

review_title: Seems to be a better place for faculty than for staff
pros:
Rewarding to be a part of an educational system
Beautiful campus
Walkable campus
Making progress in staff and faculty diversity
cons:
A little sea leaves little room for the faculty who feel they are big fish. 
Staff are an afterthought
History of privileged students has given HWS a bad reputation in the community.

job_title: Office of Advancement Student Worker in Geneva, NY
pros: This job was great for me as a student worker.  Very flexible hours that work around your schedule.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of with my job at the colleges.  The people are great and make work enjoyable.

review_title: Just an awesome happiness that keeps me getting out of bed in the morning!
pros: Beautiful campus, friendly people, great benefits, lectures and sporting events to attend, and working with students keeps you young!
cons: Managers refuse to address the long term employees lacking skills even with the technology tools given to improve internal processes.

review_title: Great experience with hard working staff
job_title: IT Support Specialist in Geneva, NY
pros: Friendly people on staff, good benefits, not very hectic in any department. The students are great to work with and always changing.
cons: Not a lot of room for growth, most of the people you help graduate and move one, leaving no connections

review_title: I worked at hobart and William Smith Colleges for 3 years as a student worker
job_title: Front Dest Assistant in Geneva, NY
pros: Very nice people to work with, great work-life balance, get assigned to some good tasks, was a good experience with professional colleagues.
cons: what I did was not totally relevant to my major. Pay is not very high.

review_title: A Place for Freedom, Responsibility, and Community
pros: Great place for students to create relationships with professors and work as teaching assistants, etc. Great place to earn extra money without leaving the academic setting.
cons: Positions like this may not be a given. You must network and create opportunities for yourself.

pros:
Excellent benefits (tuition exchange and reimbursement, medical, retirement match, generous vacation and sick time).
They promote within.
Strong company values.
cons: Pay is lower due to higher ed status, but benefits weigh out lower pay.

review_title: Beautiful Place, Excellent People, Best Work Environment
pros:
Provide plenty of options for student workers
Able to pursue work in desired field
Gain professional experience while still attending school
cons: Only minimum work-study pay available

pros: Great Colleges on a beautiful campus with professors that truly care about their students.
cons: It is expensive to attend and there is not much to do in the area but it is a safe community.

review_title: A great job to start off a communications career
pros: Great manager, fun opportunities, great products from the office
cons: Low salary, but it was a start. Sometimes left out of meetings I wanted to me included in.

pros: Supportive community, beautiful location, everyone shares in the excitement of working at HWS
cons: biweekly pay system, harsh winters, students have little chance to make more than minimum wage

pros: Solid place to work as a TA, Professors are super helpful.
cons: Sometimes people ask dumb questions. Instead of thinking before speaking.

job_title: Associate Director of Career Services in Geneva, NY
pros: Beautiful campus, most people really care about their job and the students.
cons: The pay is not great and could be improved

pros: Got to put something good on my resume
cons: Got no money and my name was not on the paper

pros:
Offers good work study program
Safe place to work
cons: Not all positions are handicap accessible

pros: Excellent communication amongst researchers and research assistants.
cons: None. Great place to work and learn.
